channel.title: Spam on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Spam on My New Hugo Site

item.title: No Thanks, Spammers
item.description: [big]Tedium has a decent number of readers, but when it comes down to it, it’s a small blip on the larger internet—a small professional publisher at a time when so many of our publishers are large and centralized.[/big] As a result of this relatively unique status, I get a lot of messages on a fairly regular basis asking me to do one of a few things: Update a link on a story I’ve already written to get in a business I didn’t previously mention.

item.title: The Chinese Robocall Blues
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: Recently, I got a phone call from a number I’d never seen before. In other words, an average day. But this call was weird, largely because it was decidedly not for me. It sounded like Chinese, which was confirmed when I had the bright idea of holding my phone against my laptop’s microphone so Google Translate could make it out. Suddenly, it became slightly more clear: The message was a robocall—a strange one at that, one that suggested some sort of immigration trouble for the caller.
